value.title: Microsoft and Intel project converts malware into images before analyzing it
value.excerpt: Microsoft and Intel have recently collaborated on a new research project that explored a new approach to detecting and classifying malware. Called STAMINA (STAtic Malware-as-Image Network Analysis), the project relies on a new technique that converts malware samples into grayscale images and then scans the image for textural and structural patterns specific to malware samples.

images.title: Microsoft and Intel project converts malware into images before analyzing it
